content.text: In this lesson, you'll learn how to talk about your daily routine, or 'Tagesablauf', in German. We'll cover everything from morning to evening.

data.tip: This is a separable verb. The stress is on 'auf', and in a simple sentence, this part moves to the end. For example: 'Ich stehe auf'.

content.text: To say you travel 'by' something, use 'mit dem' for masculine (der) and neuter (das) nouns. For example, 'mit dem Bus' or 'mit dem Fahrrad'.

content.title: Discussing your morning
content.setting: Your German friend, Alex, starts a conversation about your daily routines. Begin by talking about your morning.

conversation_flow.title: Say what time you get up
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Hallo! Ich stehe um sechs Uhr auf. Und du?

conversation_flow.title: Mention what you have for breakfast
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Super. Ich trinke Kaffee zum Frühstück. Und du?

conversation_flow.title: Explain how you go to work
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Super! Ich fahre mit dem Fahrrad zur Arbeit. Und du?

content.text: Great! Now let's talk about the workday. We'll learn more separable verbs.
Remember `aufstehen`? The verb `anfangen` is also separable. The `an-` part moves to the end of the sentence. For example: `Ich fange an`.

data.phrase: Ich esse um ein Uhr zu Mittag
data.meaning: I eat lunch at one o'clock

content.title: Talking about your workday
content.setting: The conversation with Alex continues. Now, describe your typical workday schedule.

conversation_flow.title: State what time you start working
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Toll! Und die Arbeit? Ich fange um neun Uhr an. Und du?

conversation_flow.title: Say what time you have lunch
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Gut. Ich esse um ein Uhr zu Mittag. Und du?

conversation_flow.title: Mention what time you finish work
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Prima. Ich bin um fünf Uhr fertig. Und du?

content.text: Excellent work! Let's finish the day by talking about your evening activities.
Word order: If you start a sentence with a time or phrase like 'Nach der Arbeit', the verb comes second, before the subject 'ich'. For example: 'Nach der Arbeit koche ich'.

data.phrase: Ich esse um sieben Uhr zu Abend
data.meaning: I eat dinner at seven o'clock

content.title: Describing your evening
content.setting: You're wrapping up your conversation with Alex. Tell him about your evening and ask about his.

conversation_flow.title: Describe what you do after work
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Wow! Nach der Arbeit koche ich. Und du?

conversation_flow.title: Say what time you have dinner
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Schön! Ich esse um sieben Uhr zu Abend. Und du?

conversation_flow.title: Ask about their routine in return
